description: An exiled blacksmith of a resilient, craftsmen people. His immense, scaled body is a living fortress, and his will is as unbending as the star-metal he dreams of forging.

lore.background: An exiled blacksmith of the Pangolin-kin, a people of resilient craftsmen who carve their immense Forge-Cities into the heart of the Iron Peaks. He aims to craft a legendary weapon to defeat the Champions of Order who have stolen sacred relics from his clan and to forge a new legacy for himself.
lore.narrative_hook: The Champions of Order have stolen relics from Torr's clan, which the party must recover. His crafting skills can be used to repair or upgrade the party's gear throughout the campaign.

starting_moves.name: Stand Guard
starting_moves.description: When you plant your feet to defend an ally, a position, or an object, roll `2d6 + Force`. On a **10+**, you are an immovable object; no harm will come to your charge. On a **7-9**, you hold, but at a cost; you protect your charge, but you take the full brunt of the attack, marking 2 Harm instead of 1.

starting_moves.name: Sunder
starting_moves.description: When you **Engage in Battle** with your warhammer, you can choose to deal 1 less harm to instead shatter your opponent's gear. On a **10+**, their weapon is destroyed or their armor is rendered useless. On a **7-9**, their gear is merely damaged, giving them a penalty on their next action.

starting_moves.name: Master Craftsman
starting_moves.description: When you have time and tools to repair or improve a piece of gear, roll `2d6 + Wits`. On a **10+**, you do it perfectly, granting the item a permanent +1 bonus (e.g., +1 Harm, +1 Armor). On a **7-9**, you do it, but it's a temporary fix or requires a rare component you now lack. An item can only be improved this way once.

advanced_moves.name: Rune of Warding
advanced_moves.description: When you use Master Craftsman on a piece of armor or a shield, you can choose to inscribe it with a temporary Pangolin-kin ward. Roll 2d6 + Wits. On a 10+, choose an element (Fire, Ice, Lightning); the wearer is resistant to that element for the rest of the day. On a 7-9, the rune is unstable; it will only protect against the next time they would take that type of harm.

advanced_moves.name: Unbreakable Spirit
advanced_moves.description: Your will is as unbending as the star-metal you seek. When you Stand Guard to protect an ally, on a 10+, you can choose to take the harm for them. If you do, the harm is reduced by 1 before you mark it.

advanced_moves.name: Knowledge of the Forge
advanced_moves.description: You are a master of materials and their weaknesses. When you Survey a structure or Investigate a construct, you gain +1 to your roll and can always ask the question: 'What is its structural weak point?'

advanced_moves.name: Rolling Charge
advanced_moves.description: When you curl into a ball and roll into the fray, roll `2d6 + Force`. On a **10+**, you crash through your enemies, dealing your harm to up to three of them and scattering them. On a **7-9**, you still deal your harm, but your path is halted by the strongest foe.

bond_synergy.name: Forge of Legends
bond_synergy.description: When Rya's draconic power is on full display, Torr is inspired. Once per session, he can attempt to use his **Master Craftsman** move in the heat of battle, taking only a few moments to make a critical battlefield repair or upgrade. Rya's draconic scales temporarily harden in response to the masterwork forging; Rya gains +1 Armor for the scene.
